training_organizations.name: South Carolina DSS Child Welfare Training (Child Welfare Academy)
training_organizations.description: A collaborative training initiative between SC Department of Social Services and the University of South Carolina. The DSS Child Welfare Academy provides comprehensive training for new child welfare workers (covering investigative techniques, risk assessment, legal procedures, and DSS policy) and continued education for existing staff and supervisors. It also incorporates simulation training to better prepare workers for field experiences.

training_organizations.name: Eckerd Connects
training_organizations.description: In South Carolina, DSS has contracted with Eckerd Connects for certain family preservation and prevention services:contentReference[oaicite:38]{index=38}. Notably, Eckerd ran a "Strengthening Families" program to help at-risk families safely keep children at home. While core case management remains with DSS, Eckerd’s role as an NGO service provider helps SC DSS expand its reach in providing intensive, home-based services aimed at preventing foster care placements.

training_organizations.name: Miracle Hill Ministries
training_organizations.description: A faith-based nonprofit in South Carolina that operates multiple children’s homes, emergency shelters, and foster care programs. Miracle Hill recruits foster families (particularly within church communities) and provides foster home licensing and support under state oversight. For example, DSS may place children with Miracle Hill foster families for care. The organization also offers residential care for older youth. It demonstrates how SC leverages private faith-based partners to provide placement resources and care for children in need.

perpetrator_relationships.relationship: Victim Was Child of Boyfriend or Girlfriend

healthy_marriage.recipient_name: SOUTH CAROLINA CENTER FOR FATHERS AND FAMILIES

policies.TribalFoster: Yes, Tribes within state provide foster care
policies.InvestQual_SW: Yes, recommended or preferred, but not required
policies.DecentralScreen: Each county/region has own screening unit
policies.ScreenerQual_SW: Yes, recommended or preferred, but not required
policies.Def_OtherSpecify: Encourages, condones, or approves the commission of delinquent acts by the child and those acts are shown to be the result of the encouragement, condonation, or approval
policies.FatalitiesReview: Yes, reviews are required for all or some cases
policies.CaseManagerQual_SW: Yes, recommended or preferred, but not required
policies.Exempt_OtherSpecify: Child's absences from school may not be considered abuse or neglect unless the school has made efforts to bring about the child's attendance and those efforts were unsuccessful because of the parents' refusal to cooperate
policies.Reporter_OtherSpecify: Undertaker, funeral home director, or employee of a funeral home
policies.DecentralizedReporting: Each county/region has own reporting hotline
policies.InvestReq_OtherSpecify: Notify law enforcement, when necessary; Make contact with Family Independence/Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program to assist in locating the family; Notify foster care staff of infant coming into custody under Safe Haven Act; Consider barriers to communication (e.g., Limited English Proficiency, Sensory Impaired); Identify race/ethnicity and immigrant status of child and family; Determine and document tribal membership; Notify the subject of the report that it is being investigated; Screen for domestic violence, substance abuse, mental illness or criminal activity of parents; Assess school performance, attendance, and behaviors; Assess responses of parent/guardian to abuse/neglect; Photographs; X-rays or other tests
policies.SafeHaven_OtherSpecify: The person must leave the infant in the physical custody of a staff member or employee of the safe haven
policies.ScreenReq_OtherSpecify: Identifying and other information of reporter; Identifying and other information of family/household members; Information on prior maltreatment
policies.ScreenInfo_OtherSpecify: How to locate parent or caretaker; Information and ages of other children in the family; Relationship of reporter to victim and family; Prior known abuse or neglect; Reporter's source of information; Reporter's level of knowledge of the alleged abuse or neglect
policies.DefHarm_VaryByTypeSpecify: Mental injury (emotional maltreatment) specifies impairment of mental or emotional condition; Physical injury specifies death or permanent or temporary disfigurement or impairment of any bodily organ or function
policies.DefPerp_VaryByTypeSpecify: The perpetrator is not defined for human trafficking but state statute notes it extends beyond parent, guardian, or other person responsible for the child's welfare
policies.InvestQual_ExperienceSpecify: 1 year experience in a related field; Experience as a professional Social Worker with a bachelor's or master's degree in a Social Work or Social Welfare program
policies.InvestReq_OtherCases_Specify: Photographs, X-rays, and other tests are only required for physical abuse, and only when extreme enough to be warranted;; Notifying law enforcement is only required for sexual abuse; All other activities are required for all cases
policies.ReporterPenalty_OtherSpecify: Undertaker, funeral home director, or employee of a funeral home
policies.DefMal_Harm_VaryByTypeSpecify: Definition of abandonment does not require harm or risk or harm; Definition of approving commission of delinquent acts does not specify harm or risk or harm; All other types of maltreatment include harm or risk of harm
policies.CaseManagerQual_ExperienceSpec: 1 year of experience in a field related to Child Welfare or Human Services case management
policies.InvestReq_MedEvalCases_Specify: Child fatalities; Sexual abuse; Head injury in children under the age of 3; Burns in children under age 3; Fractures in children under age 5; Bruises located on the face, neck, chest, back, buttocks with a pattern or multiple in number; Sexually transmitted diseases in children under age 11
policies.ScreenerQual_ExperienceSpecify: 1 year of experience in a field related to social work is required for applicants without a bachelor's degree in social work, behavioral, or social science discipline; Experience as a social worker is required for applicants with bachelor's or master's degree in social work
policies.AltResp_EligibilityMaltreatment: All types of maltreatment are eligible
policies.AltResp_EligibilityRiskToolSpec: Intake CPS Assessment Tool; Safety Threshold Criteria (ISOLVE)
